In which year was Rahul born?
statements: I. Rahul at present is 25 years younger to his mother.
II. Rahul's brother, who was born in 1964, is 35 years younger to his mother.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: What will be the total weight of 10 poles, each of the same weight?
statements: I. One-fourth of the weight of each pole is 5 kg.
II. The total weight of three poles is 20 kilograms more than the total weight of two poles.
options: II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Either I or II is sufficient

questions.question: How many children does M have?
statements: I. H is the only daughter of X who is wife of M.
II. K and J are brothers of M.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Neither I nor II is sufficient

questions.question: How much was the total sale of the company?
statements: I. The company sold 8000 units of product A each costing Rs. 25.
II. This company has no other product line.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: The last Sunday of March, 2006 fell on which date?
statements: I. The first Sunday of that month fell on 5th.
II. The last day of that month was Friday.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Either I or II is sufficient

questions.question: What is the code for 'sky' in the code language?
statements: I. In the code language, 'sky is clear' is written as 'de ra fa'.
II. In the same code language, 'make it clear' is written as 'de ga jo'.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Neither I nor II is sufficient

questions.question: How many children are there between P and Q in a row of children?
statements: I. P is fifteenth from the left in the row.
II. Q is exactly in the middle and there are ten children towards his right.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: How is T related to K?
statements: I. R's sister J has married T's brother L, who is the only son of his parents.
II. K is the only daughter of L and J.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: How is J related to P?
statements: I. M is brother of P and T is sister of P.
II. P's mother is married to J's husband who has one son and two daughters.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient

questions.question: How is X related to Y?
statements: I. Y and Z are children of D who is wife of X.
II. R's sister X is married to Y's father.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Either I or II is sufficient

questions.question: Among T, V, B, E and C, who is the third from the top when arranged in the descending order of their weights?
statements: I. B is heavier than T and C and is less heavier than V who is not the heaviest.
II. C is heavier than only T.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
questions.answer: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient

questions.question: Which word in the code language means 'flower'?
statements: I. 'de fu la pane' means 'rose flower is beautiful' and 'la quiz' means 'beautiful tree'.
II. 'de la chin' means 'red rose flower' and 'pa chin' means 'red tea'.
options: II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Neither I nor II is sufficient

questions.question: How many students in a class play football?
statements: I. Only boys play football.
II. There are forty boys and thirty girls in the class.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Neither I nor II is sufficient

questions.question: Who is C's partner in a game of cards involving four players A, B, C and D?
statements: I. D is sitting opposite to A.
II. B is sitting right of A and left of D.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: How many total employees are there in the organization?
statements: I. There are 40 male employees and 60 female employees.
II. The total number of employees is three times the number of male employees.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: How is Sulekha related to Nandini?
statements: I. Nandini is the only sister of Sulekha's father.
II. Sulekha has one brother who is married to Nandini.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
questions.answer: Either I or II is sufficient

questions.question: Can Ritesh retire from office X in January 2006, with full pension benefits?
statements: I. Ritesh has served the office for more than 30 years.
II. The retirement age is 60 years and Ritesh is 58 years old.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: What is the code for 'or' in the code language?
statements: I. 'and or not' is coded as 'ra fa ta'.
II. 'or not yes' is coded as 'ta la pa'.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Either I or II is sufficient

questions.question: Madan is elder than Kamal and Sharad is younger than Arvind. Who among them is the youngest?
statements: I. Arvind is elder than Kamal.
II. Madan is elder than Arvind.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
questions.answer: II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient

questions.question: On which date in August was Kapil born?
statements: I. Kapil was born on a Monday.
II. Kapil's birthday falls on the 20th of August.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: What is Gagan's age?
statements: I. Gagan, Vimal and Kunal are all of the same age.
II. Total age of Vimal, Kunal and Anil is 32 years and Anil is as old as Vimal and Kunal together.
options: II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: In a certain code, '13' means 'stop smoking' and '59' means 'injurious habit'. What do '9' and '5' mean respectively in that code?
statements: I. '157' means 'stop bad habit'.
II. '839' means 'smoking is injurious'.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Either I or II is sufficient

questions.question: How much money do Vivek and Suman have together?
statements: I. Suman has 20 rupees less than what Tarun has.
II. Vivek has 30 rupees more than what Tarun has.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Neither I nor II is sufficient

questions.question: Among Monika, Anita, Sonal, Ratna and Tanvy, who came last for the programme?
statements: I. Monika came after Anita but not after Tanvy.
II. Ratna came after Tanvy but not after Sonal.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: Who among P, Q, R, S and T is the lightest?
statements: I. R is heavier than Q and T but lighter than S.
II. S is not the heaviest.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Neither I nor II is sufficient

questions.question: How is T related to K?
statements: I. K has two sons; one of the sons is A.
II. The mother of T has only two sons - A and B.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Both I and II are sufficient

questions.question: What is the shortest distance between Devipur and Durgapur?
statements: I. Durgapur is 20 kms away from Rampur.
II. Devipur is 15 kms away from Rampur.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: Neither I nor II is sufficient

questions.question: How is A related to D?
statements: I. B is the brother of A.
II. B is D's son.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
questions.answer: Neither I nor II is sufficient

questions.question: Manoj, Prabhakar, Akash and Kamal are four friends. Who among them is the heaviest?
statements: I. Prabhakar is heavier than Manoj and Kamal but lighter than Akash.
II. Manoj is lighter than Prabhakar and Akash but heavier than Kamal.
options: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: I alone is sufficient while II alone is not sufficient

questions.question: Vinod's and Javed's salaries are in the proportion of 4 : 3 respectively. What is Vinod's salary?
statements: I. Javed's salary is 75% that of Vinod's salary.
II. Javed's salary is Rs 4500.
options: II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Neither I nor II is sufficient
Both I and II are sufficient
questions.answer: II alone is sufficient while I alone is not sufficient

questions.question: As Diwali festival is approaching Vikrant goes to his father with a view to convince him for buying crackers for Vikrant. He says, “Dad! My friend Rahul likes crackers very much.” His father replies, “Son, all crackers are harmful and all the harmful things make this world a worse place to live in.” He continued, “Even sweets are harmful.” “But Dad, Rahul is an intelligent boy.” argues Vikrant. His father replies, “I do acknowledge too that Rahul is an intelligent boy, but alas! Some intelligent boys are not wise.” With a dejected face, Rahul leaves for his tuition classes. Which of the following conclusions definitely follows?
statements: Some sweets are not harmful.
All harmful things are crackers.
Rahul does like sweets.
Rahul likes harmful things.

questions.question: Which of the following conclusions is possibly true?
statements: All intelligent boys are wise.
All wise are intelligent boys.
No cracker is liked by Rahul.
Both A and C
options: No cracker is liked by Rahul

questions.question: Which of the following conclusions doesn’t follow?
statements: All intelligent boys being Rahul is a possibility.
Rahul may not be wise.
Everything that makes this world a worse place to live in is harmful.
Some crackers are liked by Rahul.
options: All intelligent boys being Rahul is a possibility
Everything that makes this world a worse place to live in is harmful
Some crackers are liked by Rahul
questions.answer: Everything that makes this world a worse place to live in is harmful

questions.question: Which of the following statements is redundant in deriving the conclusion – “Some who are intelligent like harmful things very much”?
statements: Some intelligent boys are not wise.
Rahul likes crackers very much.
All crackers are harmful.
Rahul is an intelligent boy.
options: Some intelligent boys are not wise
questions.answer: Some intelligent boys are not wise

questions.question: Which of the following statements is required to give us the conclusion – “Some harmful things are not snacks.”?
statements: Some crackers are not snacks.
Some snacks are not crackers.
No sweets are crackers.
No cracker is snack.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Some actors are singers. All the singers are dancers.
conclusions: Some actors are dancers.
No singer is actor.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All the harmoniums are instruments. All the instruments are flutes.
conclusions: All the flutes are instruments.
All the harmoniums are flutes.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Some mangoes are yellow. Some tixo are mangoes.
conclusions: Some mangoes are green.
Tixo is a yellow.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Some ants are parrots. All the parrots are apples.
conclusions: All the apples are parrots.
Some ants are apples.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Some papers are pens. All the pencils are pens.
conclusions: Some pens are pencils.
Some pens are papers.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All the actors are girls. All the girls are beautiful.
conclusions: All the actors are beautiful.
Some girls are actors.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All the windows are doors. No door is a wall.
conclusions: Some windows are walls.
No wall is a door.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All cups are books. All books are shirts.
conclusions: Some cups are not shirts.
Some shirts are cups.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Some cows are crows. Some crows are elephants.
conclusions: Some cows are elephants.
All crows are elephants.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All birds are animals. Some animals are mammals.
conclusions: Some birds are mammals.
Some mammals are birds.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Some dogs are bats. Some bats are cats.
conclusions: Some dogs are cats.
Some cats are dogs.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All the trucks are flies. Some scooters are flies.
conclusions: All the trucks are scooters.
Some scooters are trucks.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All buildings are chalks. No chalk is toffee.
conclusions: No building is toffee.
All chalks are buildings.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All cars are cats. All fans are cats.
conclusions: All cars are fans.
Some fans are cars.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: No door is dog. All the dogs are cats.
conclusions: No door is cat.
No cat is door.
Some cats are dogs.
All the cats are dogs.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All green are blue. All blue are white.
conclusions: Some blue are green.
Some white are green.
Some green are not white.
All white are blue.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All men are vertebrates. Some mammals are vertebrates.
conclusions: All men are mammals.
All mammals are men.
Some vertebrates are mammals.
All vertebrates are men.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All the phones are scales. All the scales are calculators.
conclusions: All the calculators are scales.
All the phones are calculators.
All the scales are phones.
Some calculators are phones.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Some tables are T.V. Some T.V. are radios.
conclusions: Some tables are radios.
Some radios are tables.
All the radios are T.V.
All the T.V. are tables.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Some oranges are apples. All lemons are apples. No apple is guava.
conclusions: Some oranges are lemons.
All guavas being lemon is a possibility.
No orange is a lemon.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: A few mechanics are not plumbers. All plumbers are qualified. No qualified is skilled.
conclusions: No skilled is a plumber.
No mechanic is skilled.
Some plumbers are not mechanics.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: No cycle is tyre. Not a single tyre is tube. Every tube is puncture.
conclusions: Some punctures which are tubes are cycles as well.
No cycle is a tube.
Some punctures are not tyres.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: No panther is jaguar. Not a single jaguar is puma. Every puma is cheetah.
conclusions: Some cheetah which are puma are panther as well.
No panther is a puma.
Some cheetah are not jaguar.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: A few poets are not poetesses. All poetesses are serious. No serious is diligent.
conclusions: No diligent is a poetess.
No poet is diligent.
Some poetesses are not poets.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: No bike is a bus. All buses are trucks. All trucks are cars.
conclusions: All buses are cars.
At least some cars are trucks.

questions.question: Read the conclusions and then decide which of the given conclusions logically follows from the two given statements, disregarding commonly known facts.
questions.statements: No apple is peach. All peaches are pineapples.
conclusions: All mangoes are pineapples.
Some pineapples are apples.

questions.question: Read the conclusions and then decide which of the given conclusions logically follows from the two given statements, disregarding commonly known facts.
questions.statements: Some lions are tigers. Some tigers are panthers. All panthers are elephants.
conclusions: Some elephants are tigers.
All lions being elephants is a possibility.

questions.question: Read the conclusions and then decide which of the given conclusions logically follows from the two given statements, disregarding commonly known facts.
questions.statements: At least some Europeans are British. Every European is an American. No American is an African.
conclusions: All Americans being British is a possibility.
Some Europeans can be Africans as well.
No African is a British.
options: All I, II and III follow

questions.question: Read the conclusions and then decide which of the given conclusions logically follows from the two given statements, disregarding commonly known facts.
questions.statements: No grasshopper is an insect. No insect is a bug. All bugs are moths.
conclusions: Some bugs may be grasshoppers.
All moths being insects is a possibility.
No bug is a grasshopper.
options: All I, II and III follow

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: In a one day cricket match, the total runs made by a team were 200. Out of these 160 runs were made by spinners.
conclusions: 80% of the team consists of spinners.
The opening batsmen were spinners.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: The old order changed yielding place to new.
conclusions: Change is the law of nature.
Discard old ideas because they are old.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Government has spoiled many top ranking financial institutions by appointing bureaucrats as Directors of these institutions.
conclusions: Government should appoint Directors of the financial institutes taking into consideration the expertise of the person in the area of finance.
The Director of the financial institute should have expertise commensurate with the financial work carried out by the institute.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Population increase coupled with depleting resources is going to be the scenario of many developing countries in days to come.
conclusions: The population of developing countries will not continue to increase in future.
It will be very difficult for the governments of developing countries to provide its people decent quality of life.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Prime age school-going children in urban India have now become avid as well as more regular viewers of television, even in households without a TV. As a result there has been an alarming decline in the extent of readership of newspapers.
conclusions: Method of increasing the readership of newspapers should be devised.
A team of experts should be sent to other countries to study the impact of TV. on the readership of newspapers.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: In Japan, the incidence of stomach cancer is very high, while that of bowel cancer is very low. But Japanese immigrate to Hawaii, this is reversed - the rate of bowel cancer increases but the rate of stomach cancer is reduced in the next generation. All this is related to nutrition - the diets of Japanese in Hawaii are different than those in Japan.
conclusions: The same diet as in Hawaii should be propagated in Japan also.
Bowel cancer is less severe than stomach cancer.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: The Government run company had asked its employees to declare their income and assets but it has been strongly resisted by employees union and no employee is going to declare his income.
conclusions: The employees of this company do not seem to have any additional undisclosed income besides their salary.
The employees union wants all senior officers to declare their income first.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Monitoring has become an integral part in the planning of social development programmes. It is recommended that Management Information System be developed for all programmes. This is likely to give a feedback on the performance of the functionaries and the efficacy with which services are being delivered.
conclusions: All the social development programmes should be evaluated.
There is a need to monitor the performance of workers.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: The T.V. programmes, telecast specially for women are packed with a variety of recipes and household hints. A major portion of magazines for women also contains the items mentioned above.
conclusions: Women are not interested in other things.
An average woman's primary interest lies in home and specially in the kitchen.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: The distance of 900 km by road between Bombay and Jafra will be reduced to 280 km by sea. This will lead to a saving of Rs. 7.92 crores per annum on fuel.
conclusions: Transportation by sea is cheaper than that by road.
Fuel must be saved to the greatest extent.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: The manager humiliated Sachin in the presence of his colleagues.
conclusions: The manager did not like Sachin.
Sachin was not popular with his colleagues.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Women's organisations in India have welcomed the amendment of the Industrial Employment Rules 1946 to curb sexual harassment at the work place.
conclusions: Sexual harassment of women at work place is more prevalent in India as compared to other developed countries.
Many organisations in India will stop recruiting women to avoid such problems.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Nation X faced growing international opposition for its decision to explode eight nuclear weapons at its test site.
conclusions: The citizens of the nation favoured the decision.
Some powerful countries do not want other nations to become as powerful as they are.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: In a highly centralised power structure, in which even senior cabinet ministers are prepared to reduce themselves to pathetic countries or yesmen airing views that are primarily intended to anticipate or reflect the Prime Minister's own performances, there can be no place for any consensus that is quite different from real or contrived unanimity of opinion, expressed through a well-orchestrated endorsement of the leader's actions.
conclusions: The Ministers play safe by not giving anti-government views.
The Prime Minister does not encourage his colleagues to render their own views.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: National Aluminium Company has moved India from a position of shortage to self-sufficiency in the metal.
conclusions: Previously, India had to import aluminium.
With this speed, it can soon become a foreign exchange earner.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Jade plant has thick leaves and it requires little water.
conclusions: All plants with thick leaves require little water.
Jade plants may be grown in places where water is not in abundance.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Use 'Kraft' colours. They add colour to our life. - An advertisement.
conclusions: Catchy slogans do not attract people.
People like dark colours.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All those political prisoners were released on bail who had gone to jail for reasons other than political dharnas. Bail was not granted to persons involved in murders.
conclusions: No political-prisoner had committed murder.
Some politicians were not arrested.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Modern man influences his destiny by the choice he makes unlike in the past.
conclusions: Earlier there were fewer options available to man.
There was no desire in the past to influence the destiny.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Water supply in wards A and B of the city will be affected by about 50% on Friday because repairing work of the main lines is to be carried out.
conclusions: The residents in these wards should economise on water on Friday.
The residents in these wards should store some water on the previous day.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: People who speak too much against dowry are those who had taken it themselves.
conclusions: It is easier said than done.
People have double standards.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: The national norm is 100 beds per thousand populations but in this state, 150 beds per thousand are available in the hospitals.
conclusions: Our national norm is appropriate.
The state's health system is taking adequate care in this regard.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Our securities investments carry market risk. Consult your investment advisor or agent before investing.
conclusions: One should not invest in securities.
The investment advisor calculates the market risk with certainty.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Money plays a vital role in politics.
conclusions: The poor can never become politicians.
All the rich men take part in politics.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Vegetable prices are soaring in the market.
conclusions: Vegetables are becoming a rare commodity.
People cannot eat vegetables.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: The serious accident in which a person was run down by a car yesterday had again focused attention on the most unsatisfactory state of roads.
conclusions: The accident that occurred was fatal.
Several accidents have so far taken place because of unsatisfactory state of roads.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: In a recent survey report, it has been stated that those who undertake physical exercise for at least half an hour a day are less prone to have any heart ailments.
conclusions: Moderate level of physical exercise is necessary for leading a healthy life.
All people who do desk-bound jobs definitely suffer from heart ailments.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: A bird in hand is worth two in the bush.
conclusions: We should be content with what we have.
We should not crave for what is not.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: This world is neither good nor evil; each man manufactures a world for himself.
conclusions: Some people find this world quite good.
Some people find this world quite bad.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: The eligibility for admission to the course is minimum second class Master's degree. However, the candidates who have appeared for the final year examination of Master's degree can also apply.
conclusions: All candidates who have yet to get their Master's degree will be there in the list of selected candidates.
All candidates having obtained second class Master's degree will be there in the list of selected candidates.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Any student who does not behave properly while in the school brings bad name to himself and also for the school.
conclusions: Such student should be removed from the school.
Stricter discipline does not improve behaviour of the students.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: A Corporate General Manager asked four managers to either submit their resignations by the next day or face termination orders from service. Three of them had submitted their resignations by that evening.
conclusions: The next day, the remaining manager would also resign.
The General Manager would terminate his services the next day.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Only good singers are invited in the conference. No one without sweet voice is a good singer.
conclusions: All invited singers in the conference have sweet voice.
Those singers who do not have sweet voice are not invited in the conference.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: To cultivate interest in reading, the school has made it compulsory from June this year for each student to read two books per week and submit a weekly report on the books.
conclusions: Interest in reading can be created by force.
Some students will eventually develop interest in reading.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Applications of applicants who do not fulfil eligibility criteria and/or who do not submit applications before last date will be summarily rejected and will not be called for the written test.
conclusions: Those who are called for the written test are those who fulfil eligibility criteria and have submitted their applications before last date.
Written test will be held only after scrutiny of applications.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Recent trends also indicate that the number of child migrants in large cities is increasing. These children leave their families to join the ranks of urban poor doing odd jobs in markets, workshops, hotels or in service sectors.
conclusions: Migration to big cities should be checked.
The plight of poor children should be thoroughly studied.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: No country is absolutely self-dependent these days.
conclusions: It is impossible to grow and produce all that a country needs.
Countrymen in general have become lazy.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: The percentage of the national income shared by the top 10 percent of households in India is 35.
conclusions: When an economy grows fast, concentration of wealth in certain pockets of population takes place.
The national income is unevenly distributed in India.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Players who break various records in a fair way get special prizes. Player X broke the world record but was found to be under the influence of a prohibited drug.
conclusions: X will get the special prize.
X will not get the special prize.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Company X has marketed the product. Go ahead; purchase it if price and quality are your considerations.
conclusions: The product must be good in quality.
The price of the product must be reasonable.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Quality has a price tag. India is allocating lots of funds to education.
conclusions: Quality of education in India would improve soon.
Funding alone can enhance quality of education.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Although we have rating agencies like Crisil, ICRA, there is demand to have a separate rating agency for IT companies to protect investors.
conclusions: Assessment of financial worth of IT companies calls for separate set of skills, insight and competencies.
Now the investors investing in IT companies will get protection of their investment.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: The standard of education in private schools is much better than Municipal and Zila Parishad-run schools.
conclusions: The Municipal and Zila Parishad should make serious efforts to improve standard of their schools.
All Municipal and Zila Parishad schools should be closed immediately.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: All the organised persons find time for rest. Sunita, in spite of her very busy schedule, finds time for rest.
conclusions: Sunita is an organised person.
Sunita is an industrious person.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Domestic demand has been increasing faster than the production of indigenous crude oil.
conclusions: Crude oil must be imported.
Domestic demand should be reduced.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: He stressed the need to stop the present examination system and its replacement by other methods which would measure the real merit of the students.
conclusions: Examinations should be abolished.
The present examination system does not measure the real merit of the students.

questions.question: According to given statements, choose the conclusions that follow.
questions.statements: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
conclusions: Fashion designers do not understand the concept of beauty.
Fashion is not meant to last.

questions.question: An Indian ship laden with merchandise got drowned in the Pacific Ocean.
options: got drowned in the Pacific Ocean.
questions.answer: got drowned in the Pacific Ocean.

questions.question: I could not put up in a hotel because the boarding and lodging charges were exorbitant.
options: I could not put up in a hotel
because the boarding and lodging charges
questions.answer: I could not put up in a hotel

questions.question: The Indian radio which was previously controlled by the British rulers is free now from the narrow vested interests.
options: which was previously controlled by the British rulers
is free now from the narrow vested interests.
questions.answer: is free now from the narrow vested interests

questions.question: If I had known this yesterday I will have helped him.
A lot of travel delay is caused due to the inefficiency and lack of good management on behalf of the railways.
options: A lot of travel delay is caused
due to the inefficiency and lack of good management

questions.question: One of the members expressed doubt if the Minister was an atheist.
I have got my M.Sc. degree in 1988.
Having received your letter this morning, we are writing to thank you for the same.
options: to thank you for the same.

questions.question: If you lend him a book he will lend it to someone else and never you will get it back.
options: If you lend him a book
he will lend it to someone else
